quoteLast: on the 27th under a rolling barrage, and resulted in the capture of almost the whole of Bourlon Wood, the highest piece of ground for miles round. Our losses were very heavy, but the success was a most important one, and in the battle our tired Division met and shattered a division of Prussian Guards which had to be withdrawn from the line after only 24 hours in action.
title: War Services of the 62nd West Riding Divisional Artillery
author: Anderson, Austin Thomas, 1868-1949

quoteLast: the foreman of the jury entered the court, and informed the judge that there was no chance of the jury agreeing upon a verdict.

quoteLast: for Udaipur. So we packed up and went on board and took our berths, which were on the whole more comfortable than the station beds.

quoteFirst: “I looked at the time. It was
quoteLast: . The sun, a great ball of blood-red fire in a cloudless sky, was dipping into the waters of the Pacific. quoteFirst: At Genoa, Turin, Acqui, Alessandria, Antibes, and other places, two distinct phases were perceived, occasionally separated by a brief pause, the first being invariably the weaker. At some places, the observers speak of two shocks at about
quoteLast: , separated by an interval of a few seconds; and this division was noticeable as far as Salò on the shore of Lake Garda and Vicenza in Venetia. Only in Switzerland and other districts near the boundary of the disturbed area did the weaker part of the shock become insensible, the other consisting of horizontal oscillations, remarkable for their slowness and regularity, and lasting for as much as twenty or thirty seconds.
title: A Study of Recent Earthquakes
author: Davison, Charles, 1858-1940
